accessibilityGuidelines.title: A
accessibilityGuidelines.subtitle: Must have
accessibilityGuidelines.content: The success criteria at Level A are designed to be the easiest to meet, without much impact on the website design or structure. Level A is the most essential that must be met.

accessibilityGuidelines.title: AA
accessibilityGuidelines.subtitle: Need to have
accessibilityGuidelines.content: In many countries, this level is a legal requirement for certain websites and app-based digital products. Public bodies must comply with WCAG 2.1 Level AA to meet the legislation.

accessibilityGuidelines.title: AAA
accessibilityGuidelines.subtitle: Nice to have
accessibilityGuidelines.content: The AAA level includes the most stringent requirements. According to W3C, it is not recommended to mandate Level AAA conformance as a general policy for entire sites.
